citation.article-title: Nucleic acid studies on some heterofermentative lactobacilli: description of Lactobacillus malefermentans sp. nov. and Lactobacillus parabuchneri sp. nov.

p.s: Cells are rod shaped (0.8-1.0 × 2-4 μm), occurring singly, in pairs or short chains. Cells are Gram-positive and non-motile; grow at 10 and 40°C; some strains grow at 5°C; facultatively anaerobic; catalase negative; heterofermentative; gas is produced from L-glucose; acid is produced from L-arabinose, D-fructose, galactose, gluconate, D-glucose, maltose, melezitose, melibiose, D-raffinose, ribose and sucrose; some strains produce acid from lactose, mannitol, α-methyl-glucoside, and 5-keto-gluconate; acid is not produced from adonitol, amygdalin, D-arabinose, D-arabitol, Larabitol, arbutin, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, β-gentiobiose, glycerol, glycogen, 2-keto-gluconate, inositol, inulin, D-lyxose, D-mannoside, α-methyl-mannoside, β-methylxyloside, N-acetylglucosamine, rhamnose, salicin, sorbitol, L-sorbose, starch, D-tagatose, trehalose, D-turanose, D-xylose, L-xylose and xylitol; arginine dihydrolase positive; aesculin is not hydrolysed; urease and H2S are not produced; Voges-Proskauer negative; the mol% G + C content of DNA is 44; isolated from human saliva, cheese and contaminated brewery yeasts; the type strain is NCDO 2748.
The description of the type strain corresponds to that of the species except acid is produced from lactose, mannitol and 5-keto-gluconate.
Acid is not produced from α-methyl-glucoside.
